title: Bangladesh strongly condemns attack on peacekeepers in Sudan
body: Bangladesh yesterday strongly condemned the attack on Bangladeshi peacekeepers serving under the United Nations peacekeeping mission in Sudan. Six Bangladeshi peacekeepers were killed and eight others injured in a drone attack on a United Nations base in Abyei, Sudan. "Bangladesh mourns the deaths of its valiant sons and has expressed deep condolences to the bereaved families. At the same time, the government and the people of Bangladesh have offered prayers for the healing and early recovery of the injured," said a statement from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. "The government, through its Permanent Mission to the United Nations in New York, has requested the UN to ensure the best possible medical treatment for the injured peacekeepers. "The Bangladesh Mission in New York is in close contact with the UN and is working jointly to extend all necessary support to the Bangladeshi peacekeeping contingent stationed there," it added.
